alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:37AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Scattered thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Garvin, southwestern Seminole, southeastern Oklahoma, southwestern Lincoln, Cleveland, central Pontotoc, Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 236 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a broad area of scattered thunderstorms, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Shawnee, Del City, Ada, Newcastle, Tecumseh, Pauls Valley, Purcell, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, Slaughterville, McLoud, Spencer, Jones, Nicoma Park, and Lexington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 69 and 119. Interstate 40 between mile markers 154 and 192. Interstate 44 between mile markers 147 and 159. Interstate 240 between mile markers 5 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
